author: Alex Brown
text:
Last week Fitch Ratings released its 2012 outlook report for U.S. local governments. Overall the outlook is similar to 2011, with 91% of local governments projected as stable. The report does identify four key issues of concern for municipal governments in 2012: growing pension liabilities, dynamic labor conditions, real estate strain, and reduced amounts of state aid. The full report is attached.
Below is an article which highlights one of the worst case scenarios for municipal governments in Rhode Island under the pension liability category. It references research produced by Moody's Investor Services, another ratings agency:
http://bit.ly/tmC3DV
What thoughts do you have about this outlook? Were any potential issues or concerns omitted that you think should be watched for in 2012?
title: 2012 Local Government Credit Ratings Outlook
